Row.Text: Unique Nri Forge that can be built anywhere. When constructed, converts all unimproved sources of [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron within three tiles to [ICON_RES_COPPER] Copper.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Mines worked by this City gain +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each source of [ICON_RES_COPPER] Copper and [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron worked by this City produces +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

The role of the eze Nri is not complete until the journey to the sacred Anambra River has taken place. There, the eze Nri must demonstrate their blessing by collecting stones from beneath the water, before being buried, exhumed, and anointed in white clay. Only following this can the eze Nri have his people's trust and approval. ------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Requirements:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Nri. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have at least one city on a river. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have founded a Religion. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Costs:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_PEACE] Faith. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Gain 2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrate. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]A [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age begins.

The role of the eze Nri is not complete until the journey to the sacred Anambra River has taken place. There, the eze Nri must demonstrate their blessing by collecting stones from beneath the water, before being buried, exhumed, and anointed in white clay. Only following this can the eze Nri have his people's trust and approval. ------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Requirements:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Nri. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have at least one city on a river. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have a Government. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have founded a Religion. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Costs:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_PEACE] Faith. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Gain 2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrate. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Passes the [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Divine Right (Legitimacy) Reform without incurring Cooldown.

The role of the eze Nri is not complete until the journey to the sacred Anambra River has taken place. There, the eze Nri must demonstrate their blessing by collecting stones from beneath the water, before being buried, exhumed, and anointed in white clay. Only following this can the eze Nri have his people's trust and approval. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Gain 2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrate. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]A [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age begins.

The role of the eze Nri is not complete until the journey to the sacred Anambra River has taken place. There, the eze Nri must demonstrate their blessing by collecting stones from beneath the water, before being buried, exhumed, and anointed in white clay. Only following this can the eze Nri have his people's trust and approval. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Gain 2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrate. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Passes the [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Divine Right (Legitimacy) Reform without incurring Cooldown.
{1_LeaderName} of {2_CivDesc} has journeyed to their sacred Anambra River, completing their ascension to religious leadership.

The Ìkénga - priets and noblemen - are our eyes and ears. But they have become too disconnected from the sacred. We must bridge this gap, and give the Ìkénga once again a heavenly purpose. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Requirements:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Nri. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have founded a Religion. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Costs:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_PEACE] Faith. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Markets and Temples yield +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.

The Ìkénga - priets and noblemen - are our eyes and ears. But they have become too disconnected from the sacred. We must bridge this gap, and give the Ìkénga once again a heavenly purpose.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Markets and Temples yield +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.

The Old Gods are a relic of our former misguidance. The truth is imminent, and we must follow it. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Requirements:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Lithuania. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have a religion in your Capital. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Costs:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All pantheon and non-religious followers are converted to {2_ReligionDesc}. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forests no longer convert your cities to your pantheon. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forests yield +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.

The Old Gods are a relic of our former misguidance. The truth is imminent, and we must follow it. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Requirements:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Lithuania. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must not have a State Religion. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have a religion in your Capital. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Costs:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_ReligionDesc} becomes your State Religion. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All pantheon and non-religious followers are converted to {2_ReligionDesc}. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forests no longer convert your cities to your pantheon. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forests yield +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.

The Old Gods are a relic of our former misguidance. The truth is imminent, and we must follow it. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All pantheon and non-religious followers are converted to {1_ReligionDesc}. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forests no longer convert your cities to your pantheon. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forests yield +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.

The Old Gods are a relic of our former misguidance. The truth is imminent, and we must follow it. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]A State Religion was established. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All pantheon and non-religious followers were converted to this State Religion. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forests no longer convert your cities to your pantheon. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forests yield +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
{1_LeaderName} of {2_CivName} has abandoned their old Gods and adopted {3_ReligionDesc}.

It is once again time for the Year Counting Ceremony: Igu Aro; whence all our loyal subjects pay tribute to our great spiritual guide and are unified in our benevolance. Let us rejoice and pass the yams![NEWLINE]
He who offers the greatest tribute shall have my blessing and some yams.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]The city other than the capital with the highest [ICON_PEACE] Faith output begins celebrating 'We Love the King Day' for {1_Num} turns[ENDCOLOR]
{1_CityName} has received our blessing for their great tribute to our unity.
The Year Counting Ceremony begins in the {1_CivName}.

Our reputation as an empire of unyielding peace and freedom has attracted a number of slaves from the City-State of {1_CityStateName} to come to our court seeking refuge. They ask that we free them of their servile bonds, and that we may let them live amongst our people.[NEWLINE]
No thanks. Our relationship with {1_CityStateName} is too important.
We have turned away runaway slaves from {1_CityStateName}, pleasing them immensely.
Their bonds are broken. Let no man own these people so long as they are of Nri.

[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lose {1_Num} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with {2_CityStateName}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital[ENDCOLOR]
We have accepted the runaway slaves from {1_CityStateName} into our empire.
Very well. But put them to work!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lose {1_Num} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with {2_CityStateName}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gain a free Worker Unit[ENDCOLOR]
We have accepted the runaway slaves from {1_CityStateName} into our empire and have put them straight to work.
